name: speak_to_agent
description: Sends a message to a previously spawned AI agent and receives its response. Enables communication with agents created using spawn_agent.
author: SynthDev Team

function.name: speak_to_agent
function.description: Sends a message to a spawned AI agent and returns its response. Use this to communicate with agents that were created using the spawn_agent tool. The agent will process the message according to its role and capabilities, and provide a response based on its specialized knowledge and available tools. This enables delegation of specific tasks to specialized agents.

agent_id.description: The unique identifier of the agent to send the message to. This is the agent_id returned when the agent was spawned using spawn_agent tool.

message.description: The message to send to the agent. Be clear and specific about what you want the agent to do. The agent will respond according to its role and capabilities. Examples: 'Please review this code for security issues', 'Write unit tests for the user authentication module', 'Analyze the performance of this algorithm'.

response_format.description: Returns JSON object with 'success' (boolean), 'timestamp' (ISO string), 'tool_name' (string). On success: 'agent_id' (ID of the agent that responded), 'message_sent' (the message that was sent), 'agent_response' (the agent's response to the message), 'response_timestamp' (when the agent responded). On failure: 'error' (string describing the issue). Common errors include: agent not found, agent not accessible, or communication failure.
